chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
a: nat -> R

Goal:
a 0%nat = 0 -> Series a = Series (fun k : nat => a (S k))

Premises:
Series = fun a : nat -> R => real (Lim_seq (sum_n a)) : (nat -> R) -> R Argument scope is [function_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Series_incr_1 : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> Series a = a 0%nat + Series (fun k : nat => a (S k))
Series_incr_n : forall (a : nat -> R) (n : nat), (0 < n)%nat -> ex_series a -> Series a = sum_f_R0 a (Init.Nat.pred n) + Series (fun k : nat => a (n + k)%nat)
Series_ext : forall a b : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> Series a = Series b
is_series_unique : forall (a : nat -> R) (l : R), is_series a l -> Series a = l
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0%nat | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Argument scope is [N_scope]
ex_series_incr_1 : forall a0 : nat -> ?V, ex_series a0 < -> ex_series (fun k : nat => a0 (S k)) where ?K : [a : nat -> R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R |- NormedModule ?K]
sum_n_Reals : forall (a : nat -> R_AbelianGroup) (N : nat), sum_n a N = sum_f_R0 a N
Series_correct : forall a : nat -> R, ex_series a -> is_series a (Series a)
is_series_decr_1 : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (l : ?V), is_series (fun k : nat => a0 (S k)) (plus l (opp (a0 0%nat))) -> is_series a0 l where ?K : [a : nat -> R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R |- NormedModule ?K]
Alembert_C4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C6 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x k : R), 0 < k -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> Rabs x < / k -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
Rabs_div : forall a b : R, b <> 0 -> Rabs (a / b) = Rabs a / Rabs b
sum_n = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope]
Rdiv_minus_distr : forall a b c : R, b <> 0 -> a / b - c = (a - b * c) / b
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0%nat => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
ex_series_incr_n : forall (a0 : nat -> ?V) (n : nat), ex_series a0 < -> ex_series (fun k : nat => a0 (n + k)%nat) where ?K : [a : nat -> R |- AbsRing] ?V : [a : nat -> R |- NormedModule ?K]
real = fun x : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => x0 | _ => 0 end : Rbar -> R real is a coercion
pos = fun p : posreal => let (pos, _) := p in pos : posreal -> R pos is a coercion
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : N => match a with | 0%N => (0%N, 0%N) | N.pos na => match b with | 0%N => (0%N, a) | N.pos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : N -> N -> N * N Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S n' => match m with | 0%nat => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
ex_series = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (a : nat -> V) => exists l : V, is_series a l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (nat -> V) -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope]
Ring.sort = fun t : Ring => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : Ring -> Type Ring.sort is a coercion
AbelianGroup.sort = fun t : AbelianGroup => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : AbelianGroup -> Type AbelianGroup.sort is a coercion
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0%nat => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
